title: Everything to know about the Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek doping cases
description: Last year, Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek each tested positive for a banned substance. Here's where each doping case stands.﻿
author: Jake Michaels

title: Way-too-early Grand Slam predictions for the rest of 2025
description: Madison Keys won her first Grand Slam and Jannik Sinner defended his Australian Open title. What does this mean for the rest of the year? We take a look.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What is the Dubai tennis schedule?
description: Day 2 of the 2025 Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championships features a star-studded lineup with former champions Daniil Medvedev and Andrey Rublev, defending champion Ugo Humbert, Alex de Minaur and more in action on Tuesday. De Minaur will kickstart his quest for a first title this season in his opening match on the Centre Court against Marin Cilic. Rublev, fresh off his title at the Qatar ExxonMobil Open, will then take on Quentin Halys. Top seed Medvedev will face Jan-Lennard Struff after. On Court 1, Humbert will start his title defence against Jiri Lehecka. Doubles matches will take place on Court 2 and Court 3 with top seeds Marcelo Arevalo and Mate Pavic in action. View the full Dubai Tuesday order of play below. ORDER OF PLAY - TUESDAY, 25 FEBRUARY 2025 Centre Court - start 2 p.m. Marin Cilic (CRO) vs [2] Alex de Minaur (AUS) Not Before 4 p.m. [Q] Quentin Halys (FRA) vs [3] Andrey Rublev Not Before 6:30 p.m. [1] Daniil Medvedev vs Jan-Lennard Struff (GER) Gael Monfils (FRA) vs Matteo Berrettini (ITA) Court 1 - start 2:00 p.m. [8] Arthur Fils (FRA) vs Nuno Borges (POR) Alexander Bublik (KAZ) vs Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN) Jiri Lehecka (CZE) vs [5] Ugo Humbert (FRA) [Q] Christopher O'Connell (AUS) vs [6] Grigor Dimitrov (BUL) Court 2 - start 2:00 p.m. [1] Marcelo Arevalo (ESA) / Mate Pavic (CRO) vs Yuki Bhambri (IND) / Alexei Popyrin (AUS) [Q] Robin Haase (NED) / Hendrik Jebens (GER) vs [WC] Pavlos Tsitsipas (GRE) / Petros Tsitsipas (GRE) Jamie Murray (GBR) / John Peers (AUS) vs [WC] Jeevan Nedunchezhiyan (IND) / Vijay Sundar Prashanth (IND) Court 3 - start 2:00 p.m. [LL] Luca Nardi (ITA) vs [Q] Marton Fucsovics (HUN) [Q] Roman Safiullin vs Tallon Griekspoor (NED) Nikola Mektic (CRO) / Michael Venus (NZL) vs [2] Harri Heliovaara (FIN) / Henry Patten (GBR) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Jarry & Etcheverry launch Santiago event in style
description: Home favourite Nicolas Jarry and Argentine Tomas Martin Etcheverry helped launch the Movistar Chile Open in style Sunday in Santiago. Jarry and Etcheverry, who met in the final at the ATP 250 in 2023 (the Chilean won), enjoyed playing mini tennis, taking in a folkloric dance performance and tasting local food. "I really like it at home, with family, friends and most of the people who support you throughout the year, so it's special," Jarry said. "I hope to enjoy it a lot, to be able to play my best tennis round by round, then we'll see what the future brings." The seventh-seeded Jarry and fifth-seeded Etcheverry ate empanadas de pino and sopaipillas — typical Chilean cuisine — at the Centro Cultural de Las Condes before the start of the tournament.  "The truth is that I really like playing here. I lost the final two years ago after a great match there with Nico," Etcheverry said. "I'm happy to be back this year. The crowd is incredible, I love playing here and I always have a lot of encouragement." [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Sinner Dominates in One Sided Australian Open Final
description: Jannik Sinner successfully defended his Australian Open title on Sunday, landing his third Grand Slam commandingly with a 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-3 victory over Alexander Zverev. Sinner was ruthless from the baseline and did not face a single break point throughout the two-hour, 42-minute final. The Italian showed his extra firepower from the outset, which has …
author: Jonathan

title: Australian Open 2025 Day 13 Semi Final Recap
description: Jannik Sinner and Alexander Zverev will face off in Sunday’s 2025 Australian Open final after winning their semi-finals on Friday. Alexander Zverev was the first to move into Sunday’s showpiece, defeating Novak Djokovic when the Serb retired after losing the first set on a tiebreak. Novak had not hit a tennis ball since his win …
author: Jonathan

title: Briton Evans loses in first round in Dubai
description: Britain's Dan Evans loses to Russian world number 24 Karen Khachanov in the first round of the Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championship.

title: Venus Williams turns down Indian Wells wildcard
description: Former world number one Venus Williams turns down a wildcard offer for next month's Indian Wells tournament.
